app.title: Interactive Astronomy & Monotheism
app.subtitle: Explore the cosmos through science and faith
app.instruction: Click on celestial objects to learn about their scientific significance and religious context

sun.name: The Sun
sun.description: The Sun is a G-type main-sequence star at the center of our solar system, composed primarily of hydrogen and helium undergoing nuclear fusion.

tafsir.text: Allah swears by the sun and its brightness, a sign of His power and wisdom in creation.

history.context: Ancient civilizations worshipped the sun as the source of life and power.
history.monotheism: The sun is a creation of Allah, responding to His command, rising and setting by His will, and will eventually be extinguished.

sun.monotheism_message: The sun is a sign of Allah's majesty, not an object of worship. It obeys His laws and serves His creation.

earth.name: Earth
earth.description: Earth is the only known planet that supports life. Its liquid water, protective atmosphere, and precise distance from the Sun allow stable conditions for living organisms.

quran.text: اللَّهُ الَّذِي خَلَقَ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ بِالْحَقِّ

tafsir.text: Allah created the heavens and the earth with truth, meaning for a serious purpose and with divine wisdom, not in vain.

history.context: Ancient cultures worshipped the Earth as a divine mother figure providing life.
history.monotheism: Earth is a creation of Allah, prepared as a cradle for life, not a deity to be worshipped.

earth.monotheism_message: Earth is a unique sign of Allah's mercy and power, perfectly designed to sustain life. It is a trust from the Creator, not an object of worship.

moon.name: The Moon
moon.description: The Moon is Earth's only natural satellite, orbiting at an average distance of 384,400 km. Its phases have guided calendars and inspired wonder across civilizations.

tafsir.text: Allah ordained precise phases for the moon to measure time and seasons for humanity.

history.reason: Its changing phases and influence on tides made it an object of veneration
history.verdict: The moon is subservient to Allah's will, a sign for those who reflect.

moon.monotheism_message: The moon's precise orbit is a testament to divine design, not a deity but a creation serving Allah's purpose.

sirius.name: Sirius (The Dog Star)
sirius.description: Sirius is the brightest star in the night sky, a binary star system 8.6 light-years away in the constellation Canis Major.

tafsir.text: Allah declares Himself the Lord of Sirius, which was worshipped by some Arab tribes before Islam.

history.reason: Its exceptional brightness made it a focal point for star worship
history.verdict: Sirius is merely a creation. Only Allah deserves worship.

sirius.monotheism_message: Even the brightest star is powerless before Allah. Worship belongs to the Creator alone.

al-tariq.name: Al-Tariq (The Night Visitor)
al-tariq.historical_name: Likely refers to a bright star or planet
al-tariq.description: Al-Tariq is mentioned in the Quran as a 'piercing star,' possibly referring to a pulsar or exceptionally bright celestial object.

tafsir.text: The 'piercing star' is so named because it penetrates the darkness of night with its intense light.

history.reason: Its mention in the Quran highlights Allah's power over the celestial realm
history.verdict: A reminder that even the most mysterious phenomena are under Allah's command.

al-tariq.monotheism_message: The unseen wonders of the universe point to the infinitude of Allah's knowledge and power.

venus.name: Venus
venus.historical_name: Morning Star, Evening Star, Ishtar, Aphrodite
venus.description: Venus is the second planet from the Sun and the brightest natural object in the night sky after the Moon. It has a thick, toxic atmosphere of carbon dioxide and sulfuric acid clouds.

history.reason: Its exceptional brightness and prominence as the morning/evening star led many civilizations to associate it with deities of love and beauty
history.verdict: Venus is a created celestial body under Allah's command, not a deity. It orbits in a fixed path determined by divine law.

venus.monotheism_message: Venus is a celestial sign of Allah's creation, orbiting in a precise path, bright in the dawn and dusk skies. It is not a god, but a proof of the Creator's greatness and the order in His universe.

mars.name: Mars
mars.description: Mars is the fourth planet from the Sun, known for its reddish appearance caused by iron oxide (rust) on its surface. It has a thin atmosphere, inactive volcanoes, and polar ice caps.

history.reason: Its red color associated it with blood and war in ancient mythologies
history.verdict: Mars is a created world with a specific nature determined by Allah, not a god of war.

mars.monotheism_message: Mars, with its rusty dust and mountains, is another diverse world in Allah's kingdom. Its color and orbit are signs of the Creator's artistry, stripped of ancient superstitions.

mercury.name: Mercury
mercury.description: Mercury is the smallest planet in the Solar System and the closest to the Sun. It has a rocky surface covered in craters and experiences extreme temperature fluctuations.

history.reason: Its rapid motion led ancients to associate it with messenger deities
history.verdict: Mercury is a swift-moving celestial body created by Allah, obeying precise physical laws.

mercury.monotheism_message: The swift orbit of Mercury demonstrates the precision of Allah's cosmic design. It is a sign for those who reflect on the order of the universe.

jupiter.name: Jupiter
jupiter.historical_name: The King of Planets, Zeus, Al-Mushtari
jupiter.description: Jupiter is the largest planet in our solar system. A gas giant composed mostly of hydrogen and helium, it features iconic bands of clouds and the Great Red Spot, a giant storm bigger than Earth.

history.reason: Its slow, majestic movement and brightness led ancients to view it as the king of gods
history.verdict: Jupiter is a massive creation demonstrating Allah's power. Despite its immense size, it follows a precise orbit.

jupiter.monotheism_message: Jupiter, the giant of our system, is but a small speck in Allah's dominion. Its gravity protects Earth, a sign of Allah's mercy and planning.

saturn.name: Saturn
saturn.description: Saturn is the sixth planet from the Sun and the second-largest in the Solar System. It is famous for its prominent ring system, composed mainly of ice particles, rocky debris, and dust.

history.reason: Associated with time and agriculture due to its slow movement (longest period visible to naked eye)
history.verdict: Saturn is a magnificent creation bound by time, not the god of it. Allah is the Creator of time and space.

saturn.monotheism_message: The complex beauty of Saturn's rings is a masterpiece of cosmic art. It reminds us that Allah is Al-Musawwir (The Shaper of Beauty), creating wonders beyond imagination.

neptune.name: Neptune
neptune.description: Neptune is the eighth and farthest known solar planet from the Sun. It is an ice giant with a deep blue appearance caused by methane in its atmosphere, and features the strongest winds in the solar system.

history.verdict: A modern discovery revealing the vastness of Allah's creation beyond what the naked eye can see.

neptune.monotheism_message: Orbiting in the cold darkness at the edge of our system, Neptune is a sign of Allah's encompassing power. 'And He creates what you do not know' (Quran 16:8).

uranus.name: Uranus
uranus.description: Uranus is the seventh planet from the Sun. It is an ice giant with a pale blue-green color due to methane. Unique among planets, it rotates on its side with an axial tilt of 98 degrees.

history.reason: Discovered in the 18th century, too dim for ancient identification
history.verdict: Its unique rotation is a wonder of creation, showing the diversity of Allah's design.

uranus.monotheism_message: Uranus, rolling on its side in deep space, demonstrates that Allah's creation is not bound by a single pattern. He creates what He wills, in infinite variety.

pluto.name: Pluto
pluto.description: Pluto is a dwarf planet in the Kuiper belt. Once considered the ninth planet, it is a world of rock and ice with a thin atmosphere and complex surface features including a heart-shaped glacier.

history.verdict: A testament to the vastness of the solar system's outer reaches.

pluto.monotheism_message: Even at the freezing fringes of the solar system, Allah's command holds sway. Pluto's lonely orbit is a sign of the vastness of His dominion.

alnitak.name: Alnitak
alnitak.description: The eastern star of Orion's Belt. It is a triple star system and one of the hottest O-type stars known.

quran.text: But nay! I swear by the setting of the stars...

tafsir.text: A sign of Allah's power in the positions of stars.

alnitak.monotheism_message: Its intense heat and light are but a spark of Allah's power.

alnilam.name: Alnilam
alnilam.description: The middle star of the belt. It is a large blue supergiant and the brightest of the three.

quran.text: And by the star when it sets

alnilam.monotheism_message: Standing in the center of the belt, it shows the order of the cosmos.

mintaka.name: Mintaka
mintaka.description: The western star of the belt. A multiple star system located very close to the celestial equator.

quran.text: And He is the Lord of Sirius (and all stars)

tafsir.text: Allah is the Lord of all celestial bodies.

mintaka.monotheism_message: The alignment of these stars is a sign of divine precision.

ceres.name: Ceres
ceres.description: Ceres is the largest object in the asteroid belt between Mars and Jupiter. It is a rocky, icy dwarf planet featuring mysterious bright spots in Occator Crater.

history.verdict: A created world, lifeless and subservient.

ceres.monotheism_message: Ceres and the asteroid belt are remnants of creation, a testament to Allah's power in forming worlds.

vesta.name: Vesta
vesta.description: Vesta is the second-largest asteroid and the brightest visible from Earth. It possesses a massive mountain at its south pole, twice the height of Everest.

history.verdict: A rocky creation in a fixed orbit.

vesta.monotheism_message: The towering peaks on this small world remind us that Allah casts mountains firmly everywhere.

pallas.name: Pallas
pallas.description: The third-largest asteroid. Its orbit is highly inclined compared to most other asteroids.
pallas.monotheism_message: Its unique, tilted path shows the diversity of trajectories Allah ordained in the cosmos.

juno.name: Juno
juno.description: One of the first four historical asteroids discovered.
juno.monotheism_message: Every stone in the heavens glorifies its Lord.

eros.name: Eros
eros.description: The first asteroid discovered orbiting near Mars, and the first to be landed on by a spacecraft (NEAR). It has an elongated, peanut-like shape.
eros.monotheism_message: Its strange shape is a sign that Allah creates whatever form He wills.

ida.name: Ida
ida.description: Famous for the discovery of its tiny moon, Dactyl, proving that even asteroids can have satellites.
ida.monotheism_message: Even small rocks have companions; Glory be to the Creator of all systems.

gaspra.name: Gaspra
gaspra.description: The first asteroid to be photographed up close by the Galileo probe. It is reddish and heavily cratered.
gaspra.monotheism_message: Its reddish hue and irregular form are signs of creation.

bennu.name: Bennu
bennu.description: A potentially hazardous asteroid rich in carbon and organic building blocks, visited by the OSIRIS-REx mission.
bennu.monotheism_message: Its potential danger reminds us that safety is in Allah's hands alone.

ryugu.name: Ryugu
ryugu.description: A diamond-shaped rubble pile asteroid visited by Hayabusa2. It looks like a spinning top.
ryugu.monotheism_message: Its precise geometric shape is evidence of the Creator's perfection.

canopus.name: Canopus (Suhail)
canopus.description: The second brightest star in the sky. In Arab culture, its rising marks the end of scorching summer heat.
canopus.monotheism_message: Allah set the stars as markers for seasons, showing His mercy to creation.

arcturus.name: Arcturus
arcturus.description: A Red Giant moving rapidly through the galaxy. It is older than our Sun.
arcturus.monotheism_message: Its immense age and size remind us of the Eternal nature of the Creator.

rigil.name: Rigil Kentaurus (Alpha Centauri)
rigil.description: Our nearest stellar neighbor. A target for future interstellar travel.
rigil.monotheism_message: Being the closest star yet so far shows the vast scale of Allah's universe.

vega.name: Vega
vega.description: A brilliant blue star that defines the zero point of magnitude scale. It was once our North Star.
vega.monotheism_message: The shifting of the North Star over millennia shows that only Allah is the Permanent Constant.

capella.name: Capella
capella.description: A golden giant star system, actually consisting of four stars paired together.
capella.monotheism_message: Its complex orbital dance of four stars attests to the balance Allah placed in the heavens.
